official-title.#text:
To require the Comptroller General to conduct a study of the interoperability of computer systems
			 used by hospitals to store and access electronic health records, and for
			 other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

header.#text:
Study on interoperability of computer systems used by hospitals to store and access electronic
			 health records

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall conduct a study of the interoperability of computer systems used by
			 hospitals to store and access electronic health records, which shall
			 explore—

text.#text:
the identity of hospitals in the United States that use, at the time the study is conducted,
			 computer systems with the ability to allow authorized personnel of more
			 than one hospital to access and update the electronic health records of
			 the same patient;

the reasons why hospitals in the United States do not have computer systems with such ability at
			 the time the study is conducted; and

the extent to which increased interoperability of such computer systems allows hospitals to more
			 effectively coordinate the care of patients.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Ways and Means of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
a
			 report on the study conducted under subsection (a), including such
			 recommendations as the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Energy and Commerce of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
considers appropriate regarding
			 the use of interoperable computer systems by hospitals to store and access
			 electronic health records as a method of improving the coordination of
			 care of patients.

text.#text: Not later than 6 months after date of the enactment of this Act, the

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 5537 IH: To require the Comptroller General to conduct a study of the interoperability of computer systems used by hospitals to store and access electronic health records, and for other purposes.
